intro: Aspidogyne jamesonii, commonly known as the Jameson's aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
